title: Add tscircuit.config.json JSON schema and include $schema when saving configs
description: Add a JSON schema for tscircuit.config.json to enable validation and auto-completion in editors, and ensure saved configs include a schema field pointing to the schema URL.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a published JSON schema for `tscircuit.config.json` so editors and tooling can validate project configs via a stable CDN URL.
- Ensure newly saved project configs include a `$schema` field pointing to the jsDelivr-hosted schema for better DX and auto-completion.
- Ship the schema in the package `types` folder so it will be available when the package is published to npm.

### Description
- Add `types/tscircuit.config.schema.json` containing the JSON schema with an `$id` hosted on jsDelivr (`https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@tscircuit/cli/types/tscircuit.config.schema.json`).
- Introduce `CONFIG_SCHEMA_URL` in `lib/project-config/index.ts` and use it to prepend `$schema` when writing `tscircuit.config.json`.
- Update `saveProjectConfig` to write a config object that includes the `$schema` property before persisting to disk.
- The schema file is placed in the `types` directory which is already included in the package `files` for publishing.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project and it completed successfully.
- Ran `bun run format` (which invokes `biome format`) and it completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_6954cefb7dc8832eb31a3c95cd117289)

title: docs: document tscircuit.config.json options and add overview table
description: Adds documentation for tscircuit.config.json options, including a configuration options table and detailed descriptions for properties like previewComponentPath and snapshotsDir.
body:
### Motivation
- Surface and document the available `tscircuit.config.json` project options discovered in the CLI codebase so users can configure projects reliably. 
- Provide a single, quick-reference table linking to longer descriptions of each property to improve discoverability. 
- Clarify behaviors that differ from common expectations such as default board file globs and default ignore patterns. 
- Document preview and snapshot configuration to support preview image/GLTF workflows and centralized snapshot storage.

### Description
- Added a configuration options table at the top of the guide linking `mainEntrypoint`, `previewComponentPath`, `ignoredFiles`, `includeBoardFiles`, and `snapshotsDir` to detailed sections. 
- Implemented a new `previewComponentPath` section explaining its purpose, precedence over `mainEntrypoint`, usage examples, and CLI setter (`tsci config set previewComponentPath`). 
- Implemented a new `snapshotsDir` section describing centralized snapshot output, examples, and how it changes the default per-file `__snapshots__` behavior. 
- Clarified `ignoredFiles` and `includeBoardFiles` documentation to reflect the CLI defaults and exact patterns used by the codebase (including `**/*.board.tsx`, `**/*.circuit.tsx`, and `**/*.circuit.json`).

### Testing
- Attempted `bun update --latest some-dep`, which failed due to `some-dep` not being found in the registry. 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` for a TypeScript check, which reported missing type/dependency errors and therefore did not succeed. 
- Ran `bun run format`, which failed because the configured formatter (`biome`) is not available in the environment. 
- No `bun test` suites were executed as part of this change set in this environment.

------

title: chore: bump version to 0.0.37
description: Automated package update

title: Fix dimension line polygon winding by switching to a unified perimeter path (no self-intersections)
description: Fixes dimension line polygon winding issues by implementing a unified perimeter path to prevent self-intersections and ambiguous fill behavior.
body:
This change adjusts the dimension-line polygon construction to avoid winding/self-intersection issues by building the main line + both arrowheads as one continuous perimeter.


Replaces the “append multiple closed sub-polygons” approach with a single ordered perimeter path from tip → arrow base → main line → arrow base → tip → back along the opposite edge.

Prevents polygon self-intersections and ambiguous fill behavior that can occur with mixed arrow + line quads in one point list.

Keeps arrow geometry tied to fromBase/toBase and strokeWidth, ensuring consistent thickness and arrow proportions across transforms.

Extension ticks are now bridged into the same fill by explicitly stitching each tick polygon into the main path (reducing winding surprises).

Updates affected dimension-related snapshots (e.g., fabrication-note dimensions) to match the corrected fill output.

title: Add support soldermask margin for the holes
description: Adds support for soldermask margins around holes in PCB designs, allowing for better visual representation and manufacturing accuracy.

title: Refactor dimension line rendering to filled polygon geometry (solid arrows & lines)
description: Refactors dimension line rendering to use filled polygon geometry instead of stroked paths, improving visual consistency and stability across orientations and scaling transforms.
body:
This change rewrites dimension line rendering to use filled polygon geometry instead of stroked paths and per-arrow draw calls.

Key improvements:

Replaces stroked V-shaped arrows with closed, filled arrow polygons for consistent visual weight.

Renders extension lines, main dimension line, and arrowheads as a single polygon path, eliminating stroke joins and cap artifacts.

Removes canvas-space angle math and drawArrow usage in favor of geometry defined directly in model space.

Ensures consistent appearance across orientations (horizontal, vertical, angled) and under scaling transforms.

Updates all affected snapshot tests to reflect the new, more stable rendering output.

Overall, this makes dimension annotations visually cleaner, more predictable, and easier to maintain by unifying all dimension geometry under polygon-based rendering.

body:
### Summary

* Added a resizable settings panel with drag handle and responsive truncation
* Introduced laser profiles (`Omni X 6W 150x150`, `Default`) with full copper/board controls
* Improved inputs with direct numeric entry and toggle switches
* Standardized types using `ConvertCircuitJsonToLbrnOptions` (removed custom types)

### Implementation Notes

* Added mouse-driven resize logic and width state
* Organized UI into **Basic**, **Advanced**, and **Laser Profile** sections

### UX Improvements

* Faster resizing and cleaner layout
* Preset-based laser configuration
* More precise and predictable input behavior

title: Enhance UI responsiveness and auto-convert circuits to LBRN
description: This PR significantly improves the circuit converter apps usability by making the interface fully responsive, adding KiCad file support, and automating LBRN generationreducing manual steps and enhancing mobiledesktop workflows.
body:
This PR significantly improves the circuit converter app's usability by making the interface fully responsive, adding KiCad file support, and automating LBRN generation—reducing manual steps and enhancing mobile/desktop workflows.
- Responsive UI overhaul: Redesigned blank workspace with mobile-friendly layouts, smaller headings, and adaptive spacing for better cross-device experience.
- Expanded file support: Updated upload area and descriptions to accept KiCad files alongside Circuit JSON, broadening compatibility.
- Auto-conversion feature: Added automatic LBRN generation when circuits load, eliminating the need for manual previews and streamlining the workflow.
- Navigation improvements: Made the app logo clickable for easy home navigation using react-router-dom.
- UI polish: Updated button labels (e.g., "Generate LBRN" instead of "Preview File") for clearer actions and added a quick start guide section.
- Dependency bump: Upgraded circuit-json-to-lbrn from 0.0.30 to 0.0.33 for latest features and bug fixes.

title: chore: bump version
description: Automated package update

title: Refactor: native PCB fabrication-note rendering with dedicated fab layers
description: Promotes PCB fabrication notes to a first-class rendering path and removes duplicated drawing logic, consolidating all fab rendering behind a single draw path.
body:
This change promotes PCB fabrication notes to a first-class rendering path and removes a large amount of bespoke, duplicated drawing logic.

Upgrades circuit-to-canvas to ^0.0.33 and switches fabrication notes to the library’s native renderer instead of manual primitive expansion.

Adds explicit top_fabrication and bottom_fabrication layers to the canvas pipeline and render ordering.

Fully removes inlined fabrication-note primitive generation (rect, path, text, dimension), consolidating all fab rendering behind a single, consistent draw path.

Introduces a dedicated fabrication drawer with viewer-specific color overrides, while retaining default behavior for all non-fabrication elements.

Reduces renderer complexity, improves separation of concerns, and ensures fabrication notes behave consistently with other layer-based PCB elements.

Overall, this is a structural cleanup and capability upgrade that simplifies the rendering stack and makes fabrication annotations easier to extend and maintain going forward.

title: Add support for Axial Capacitor with snapshot test of Axial Capacitor of 14mm pitch footprint rendering
description: Adds support for rendering axial capacitors in the 3D footprint library with a new AxialCapacitor component and snapshot test for 14mm pitch.
body:
This pull request adds support for rendering axial capacitors in the 3D footprint library. It introduces a new `AxialCapacitor` component, integrates it with the existing footprint rendering logic, provides an example usage, and adds a snapshot test to ensure correct rendering.

**New Axial Capacitor Component:**

* Added `AxialCapacitor` component in `lib/AxialCapacitor.tsx` for 3D visualization of axial capacitors, parameterized by pitch.
* Exported `AxialCapacitor` from the main library index for external use.

**Integration with Footprint Rendering:**

* Registered `AxialCapacitor` in `lib/Footprinter3d.tsx` and updated the main rendering switch to handle the `"axial"` footprint type. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R55) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R85-R86)

**Examples and Testing:**

* Added an example usage in `examples/AxialCapacitor.example.tsx` to demonstrate the new component.
* Added a snapshot test in `tests/snapshots/axial-capacitor.test.ts` to verify correct rendering of the axial capacitor with a 14mm pitch.

title: Add SMD right-angle pin row component and corresponding tests
description: Adds support for rendering SMD right-angle pin rows in the 3D footprint viewer, including new props and updated rendering logic.
body: This pull request adds support for rendering SMD right-angle pin rows in the 3D footprint viewer. The changes introduce new props to relevant components, update rendering logic to handle SMD and right-angle configurations, and add a snapshot test for the new feature. ### Feature: SMD Right-Angle Pin Row Support * Added `smd`, `surface_mount`, and `rightangle` props to the `Footprinter3d` and `PinRow` components to enable rendering of SMD right-angle pin rows (`lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`, `lib/PinRow.tsx`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-8ef5003688394a782da38d10f8dd9c9ece9af16db5a43ce66b655e6c19bb0bc9R77-R79) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b437df9b77b641cb7c8494f5bc3f5c9029fa7568c05cd37cd4923e86900fdd4dR11-R21) * Updated the rendering logic in `PinRow` to position and orient pins and body appropriately for right-angle and SMD configurations, including use of `SmdChipLead` for SMD pins (`lib/PinRow.tsx`). [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b437df9b77b641cb7c8494f5bc3f5c9029fa7568c05cd37cd4923e86900fdd4dR40-R46) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b437df9b77b641cb7c8494f5bc3f5c9029fa7568c05cd37cd4923e86900fdd4dR59-R74) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-b437df9b77b641cb7c8494f5bc3f5c9029fa7568c05cd37cd4923e86900fdd4dL72-R113) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-b437df9b77b641cb7c8494f5bc3f5c9029fa7568c05cd37cd4923e86900fdd4dR126-R129) ### Example and Testing * Added an example file demonstrating a 6-pin SMD right-angle pin row using the new props (`examples/pinRow-smd-rightangle.example.tsx`). * Added a snapshot test to verify correct rendering of the SMD right-angle pin row footprint (`tests/snapshots/pinRow-smd-rightangle.test.ts`). ### Integration * Updated the logic in `Footprinter3d` to pass the new props to `PinRow` when rendering pin row footprints (`lib/Footprinter3d.tsx`).

title: Renamed Axialcapacitor to RadialCapacitor component and update footprinter dependency
description: Refactors the codebase to replace the axial capacitor component with a radial capacitor component and updates related dependencies and references.
body:
This pull request refactors the codebase to replace the axial capacitor component with a radial capacitor component and updates related dependencies and references. The main changes include renaming files and components, updating imports, and modifying the footprint used for extruded pads. Additionally, the `@tscircuit/footprinter` dependency is updated to a newer version.

Component and file refactoring:

* Renamed `lib/AxialCapacitor.tsx` to `lib/RadialCapacitor.tsx`, and changed the component from `AxialCapacitor` to `RadialCapacitor`, updating all relevant references and props.
* Renamed `examples/AxialCapacitor.example.tsx` to `examples/RadialCapacitor.example.tsx`, updating the import to use `RadialCapacitor` and changing the footprint for `ExtrudedPads` to match the radial capacitor.

Dependency update:

* Updated the `@tscircuit/footprinter` dependency in `package.json` from version `^0.0.268` to `^0.0.281`.

title: Move sponsorship details to standalone documentation
description: This PR moves the sponsorship calculation details from the weekly contribution overview to a dedicated static document, simplifying the overview and making the sponsorship details more discoverable.
body:
### Motivation

- Keep the weekly contribution overview focused on contribution counts and remove monetary/point details from that file.
- Make the scoring and sponsorship calculation explanation discoverable from the overview but host the details in a dedicated static document.
- Avoid generating the sponsorship explanation from the same script that produces weekly overviews to simplify responsibilities.

### Description

- Added `lib/data-processing/generateSponsorshipExplanationMarkdown.ts` which produces the full sponsorship/scoring explanation content and removed that content from the weekly overview generator.
- Added a small standalone script `scripts/generate-sponsorship-calculation-explanation.ts` that writes `docs/sponsorship-calculation-explanation.md` as a static output.
- Kept contributor scoring computation available via a new helper `buildContributorScores` inside `lib/data-processing/generateMarkdown.ts` and updated `generateMarkdown` to link to `/docs/sponsorship-calculation-explanation.md` and remove score/points/bounty columns and charts.
- Updated `index.ts` to stop generating the per-week scoring file so the sponsorship explanation is managed as a separate static document.

### Testing

- Ran type check with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which completed successfully.
- Ran formatting with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.
- Executed the generator script with `bun scripts/generate-sponsorship-calculation-explanation.ts` to produce `docs/sponsorship-calculation-explanation.md`, which ran successfully.

------

title: Add package transfer API (fake) and transfer UI in package Danger Zone
description: Add a fake packagestransfer endpoint to mirror the real backend behavior for localdev usage and tests, and expose a UI flow in the package settings Danger Zone to allow transferring ownership to an organization the user is a member of.
body:
### Motivation

- Add a fake `/packages/transfer` endpoint to mirror the real backend behavior for local/dev usage and tests.
- Expose a UI flow in the package settings Danger Zone to allow transferring ownership to an organization the user is a member of.
- Enforce permission checks and ensure GitHub integration is cleared when ownership moves.

### Description

- Added `fake-snippets-api/routes/api/packages/transfer.ts` which validates package existence, permission to transfer, target org existence and membership, then updates `owner_org_id` and clears `github_repo_full_name` and `updated_at`, returning the public-mapped package via `publicMapPackage`.
- Updated `src/components/dialogs/edit-package-details-dialog.tsx` to add a transfer section inside the Danger Zone using `useListUserOrgs`, a `Select` to choose a target org, a confirmation dialog, and a `useMutation` that posts to `/packages/transfer` and invalidates queries on success.
- Reset transfer UI state when the edit dialog opens to avoid stale selection (`useEffect` to clear `targetOrgId` and `showConfirmTransfer`).
- The frontend disables transfer when no other organizations are available and surfaces server error messages via existing toast handling.

### Testing

- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran code formatting with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.
- Built the fake API bundle as part of `bun run dev` which produced the fake-api build artifacts locally (dev server start observed during verification).

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_695568916974832e919100f7832fb099)

title: style: improve layout and styling of PackageCard and PackageCardSkeleton components
description: Updates the visual design and layout of the PackageCard component and its skeleton, enhancing spacing, typography, color usage, and information hierarchy for better readability and aesthetics.
body: This pull request updates the visual design and layout of the `PackageCard` component and its skeleton, as well as the way package cards are displayed in a list. The main focus is on improving spacing, typography, color usage, and the overall information hierarchy to make package cards more visually appealing and easier to scan. **UI and Layout Improvements:** * Updated `PackageCard` to use lighter borders, rounded corners, and new hover styles for a cleaner look. Adjusted spacing and alignment of elements for better visual balance. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-5f9748c0ae0cd5f32479a6daa6b3f646ab7d9fbc392902c0479502b65b7b9d5bL89-R93) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-5f9748c0ae0cd5f32479a6daa6b3f646ab7d9fbc392902c0479502b65b7b9d5bR113-R157) * Improved the display of package information: larger and more prominent package name, enhanced owner/package separation, and better description handling with a fallback for missing descriptions. * Refined the display of metadata (stars, privacy, last updated) with clearer icons, consistent sizing, and improved grouping for readability. **Component Skeleton and Grid Updates:** * Updated `PackageCardSkeleton` to match the new card layout, including revised spacing, placeholder sizes, and arrangement of skeleton elements. * Changed the package grid and loading state layouts from a multi-column grid to a vertical stack (`space-y-2`), making the list easier to scan and more consistent with the new card style. ## Skeleton ## Results

title: Allow selecting error text in dropdown
description: Allows users to select and copy error messages from the dropdown for debugging and reporting by modifying CSS properties and event handlers in the ToolbarOverlay component.
body:
### Motivation
- The error list rows prevented text selection because row-level interaction settings and handlers intercepted pointer events.
- Users need to be able to select and copy error messages from the dropdown for debugging and reporting.

### Description
- Removed `userSelect: "none"` from the clickable error row container to allow text selection.
- Added `userSelect: "text"` to both the collapsed message and expanded message divs to explicitly enable selection.
- Added `onMouseDown` and `onClick` handlers that call `event.stopPropagation()` on the message elements to prevent the row click/touch handlers from hijacking selection.
- Changes applied in `src/components/ToolbarOverlay.tsx`.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project and it completed successfully.
- Ran `bun run format` to apply formatting and it completed successfully.

title: chore: bump version to v0.1.712
description: Automated package update

title: chore: update packages @tscircuit/runframe
description: Updates the tscircuitrunframe package from version 0.0.1457 to 0.0.1458 in the package.json file.

title: Document global silkscreen text size adjustment
description: Adds documentation for setting a global font size for silkscreen text elements in PCB designs, allowing for consistent text sizing across the board.

title: 1.5d autorouting - initial version (not enabled)
description: Add IntraNodeSolverWithJumpers for single-layer PCB routing with 0805 jumpers Add intelligent HighDensitySolver that selects solver based on node crossings This is not good enough yet- its failing to route some boards that i believe should be possible. So its currently disabled, i have a skip test that should help determine when its ready
body:
- **Add IntraNodeSolverWithJumpers for single-layer PCB routing with 0805 jumpers**
- **Add intelligent HighDensitySolver that selects solver based on node crossings**

This is not good enough yet- it's failing to route some boards that i believe should be possible. So it's currently disabled, i have a skip test that should help determine when it's ready

title: chore: bump version to 0.0.40
description: Automated package update

title: Soldermask support for SMTPads
description: Adds support for rendering soldermask coverage on SMT pads in the PCB drawing functionality.

title: Update .gitignore to include bun.lock and generated test plans and remove index.ts
description: Updates the .gitignore file to include bun.lock and generated test plans while removing the index.ts file from the repository.

title: feat(testing): Integrate SVG Snapshot Testing Framework
description: Integrates an SVG snapshot testing framework to automatically verify the visual output of the solver, ensuring project quality.
body: This PR introduces SVG snapshot testing to automatically verify the visual output of the solver, this is critical for project quality.
